001import java.awt.Window;
002import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
003import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
004
005import javax.swing.JButton;
006import javax.swing.JOptionPane;
007
008public class GameBoard implements ActionListener{
009        private int[][] winCombinations = 
010                        new int[][] { { 0, 1, 2 }, { 3, 4, 5 }, { 6, 7, 8 }, // horizontal wins
011                        { 0, 3, 6 }, { 1, 4, 7 }, { 2, 5, 8 }, // vertical wins
012                        { 0, 4, 8 }, { 2, 4, 6 } // diagonal wins
013        };
014        
015        private Window window;
016
017        private JButton[] buttons;
018        
019        private Player player1;
020
021        private Player player2;
022
023        private int count;
024
025        public GameBoard(Window window, TicTacToe ticTacToe){
026                // Assign the window where the GameBoard will be included
027                this.window = window;
028                // Creates the array of buttons of the GameBoard
029                this.buttons = new JButton[9];
030                
031                // Creates the nine buttons
032                for (int i = 0; i <= 8; i++) {
033                        // Stores the buttons in the array of buttons
034                        buttons[i] = new JButton();
035                        // 
036                        this.window.add(buttons[i]);
037                        buttons[i].addActionListener(this);
038                }
039                
040                this.count = 0;
041
042        }
043
044        public void setPlayers(Player player1, Player player2){
045                this.player1 = player1;
046                this.player2 = player2;
047        }
048        
049        @Override
050        public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent actionEvent) {
051                Player winner;
052                Mark mark;
053                
054                Object source = actionEvent.getSource();
055
056                count++;
057
058                /* Calculate whose turn it is */
059                if (count % 2 == 0) {
060                        mark = this.player2.getMark();
061                } else {
062                        mark = this.player1.getMark();
063                }
064
065                /* Write the mark to the button and deactivate it */
066                JButton pressedButton = (JButton) source;
067                // Write the mark in both the enabled and disabled modes
068                pressedButton.setIcon(mark.getIcon());
069                pressedButton.setDisabledIcon(mark.getIcon());
070                pressedButton.setEnabled(false);
071
072                /* Show a dialog when game is over */
073                if ( isThereAWinner() == true) {
074                        /* Determine who won */
075                        if (mark.equals(player1.getMark()))
076                                winner = player1;
077                        else
078                                winner = player2;
079                        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, winner + " wins the game!");
080                        int answer = JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(null, "Start",
081                                        "Do you want to start a new game",
082                                        JOptionPane.YES_NO_OPTION);
083
084                        if (answer == JOptionPane.YES_OPTION) {
085                                clearIt();
086                        } else {
087                                JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Thank you " + this.player1
088                                                + " and " + this.player2 + " for playing");
089                                System.exit(0);
090                        }
091
092                } else if (count == 9) {
093                        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "The game was tie!");
094                        int answer = JOptionPane.showConfirmDialog(null, "Start",
095                                        "Do you want to start a new game",
096                                        JOptionPane.YES_NO_OPTION);
097                        if (answer == JOptionPane.YES_OPTION) {
098                                clearIt();
099                        } else {
100                                JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Thank you " + this.player1
101                                                + " and " + this.player2 + " for playing");
102                                System.exit(0);
103                        }
104
105                }
106                
107        }
108        
109        private boolean isThereAWinner(){
110                boolean winner;
111                
112                winner = false;
113                
114                for (int i = 0; i <= 7; i++) {
115                        if ( ( this.buttons[winCombinations[i][0]].getIcon() ==  this.buttons[winCombinations[i][1]].getIcon() ) 
116                                        &&
117                                        ( this.buttons[winCombinations[i][1]].getIcon() == this.buttons[winCombinations[i][2]].getIcon() )
118                                        &&
119                                        ( this.buttons[winCombinations[i][0]].getIcon() != null) ) {
120                                winner = true;
121                        }
122                }
123        
124                return winner;
125        }
126        
127        public void clearIt(){
128                // Resets the nine buttons
129                for (int i = 0; i <= 8; i++) {
130                        buttons[i].setIcon(null);
131                        buttons[i].setEnabled(true);
132                }
133                this.count = 0;
134        }
135        
136}
